text.p: Durance: SPY - Sneak, Deceive. You were employed as a spy, infiltrating societies and guilds to spread misinformation and report back on their activities to your lord. You are adept at lying, cheating, and moving unseen.
Bonds:
1. Street Level:
a. Vorn Mur’ss – Hand servant to Qinrel (honored Shadow, spy, witness)
b. Yazae - ??? (Riddle, spinning, thread, web – dancer)
c. Dhaunithra - ??? (Infested Dragon/Wyrm )
d. Master: Qinrel Rimdor (Petals of Gold – Cold Mountain Pool)
2. PC: Glagia - Helped Glagia by gathering information on a group that was tagging the city with vile messages about Glagia's master.
Equipment
- My Mask: Full wooden mask with a greenish almost mossy hue. Adorned with a metal bar between the eyes running the bridge of its nose.
- Clothing Sets:
o Ceremonial robes - Red robes with gold trim
o Black pinstripe suit (?)
- Servant Mask: A plain matte black mask with the mark of Elthrai (Cross with curved horizontal piece) set into the forehead
- Dagger – Stiletto dagger

Background: Zilvice spent his durance in service to Qinrel Rimdor. Where he would regularly ‘visit’ other Aelfir houses. Skulking in the shadows to overhear thought to be private conversations and relaying this back to Master Rimdor gained him favor with the master and the occasional freedoms. Never really accepting Aelfir rule, he met a kindred spirit in Glaygia, who made mention of The Ministry after their durances brought them together. He has been spending time in Red Row to get away from his previous master and to truly join The Ministry’s fight to take back Spire.
SCOLEXIS CESTODA

Scrawny and unassuming, "Scolexis", is a hyper-caffeinated Red Row barista by day and sleepless researcher by night. During their durance they earned the callous moniker "Tapeworm" from their master, and so out of a lack of creativity (and some emotional trauma) they decided to adopt it as their nom-de-plume in the Ministry.

Red Row serves them well as the furthest place they could be to rouse suspicion, along with a natural place to both satisfy their addiction and to observe goings-on for their own research and the Ministry's.
Their work uniform (apron aside) used to be white. It's now a mottled biege due to repeated stains.
Occultist
+2 Shadow, Occult. You plumbed
the depths of arcane knowledge for your master,
risking your sanity by poring over forbidden tomes
in an effort to unlock the secrets within. You are
used to concealing your activities from the authorities
and decoding ancient spells.
Vermissian Sage
Core Traits
RESISTANCES: Mind +3, Shadow +1
REFRESH: Uncover hidden information.
CLASS SKILLS: Investigate, Compel
DOMAINS: Academia, Occult, Technology
BONDS
• You have an individual-level bond with an
academic, researcher or guardian of the
Vault. Name them, and their specialty.
• You have a bond with another PC – you
know a secret about them. Say who it is,
what the secret is, and whether they know
you know or not.
EQUIPMENT
Either:
• Folding crossbow (D6, Ranged,
Concealable, One-shot)
Or:
• Dagger (D3, Concealable) and padded vest
(Armour 1)
CORE ABILITIES
BACK DOOR. You throw open a door and lunge
through it into a twisted metallic nightmare: home.
Once per session, you can find an entrance
to the Vault no matter where you are in Spire
(whether it was there before you started looking
remains unclear). Inside, you’ll find a collection of
strange items and peculiar books, many of which
relate or come from alternate histories, and some
of which tell the truth. Any non-Sage character
who enters the Vault should roll Resist+Occult or
suffer Mind stress.
THE VAULT. You have access to the vast informational
resources of the sages. While inside the Vault, whether
you accessed it through a Back Door or by normal
means, you have access to equipment that will
allow you to perform an Investigate check on any
subject. It won’t confer mastery, but it will allow
you to perform the check.
OBSESSIVE RESEARCHER. You spend every
quiet moment filling your brain with knowledge –
knowledge which is often fleeting. At the start of each
session, gain a knack of your choosing in any skill
or domain, even if you don’t normally have access
to the skill or domain. At the end of the session,
you lose that knack. You can’t have the same knack
two sessions in a row; you get bored, and must
expand your mind in different ways.
Glagia Baylorn

Information broker: +2 Shadow, Investigate. You applied your unique talents for your lord’s benefit, buying and selling information, secrets and allegiances to further their political schemes. You have a keen eye for information, and are hard to track down.
Idol:
You are a beautiful artist and revolutionary, and your creations can reshape the world through bleeding-edge, half-understood sorcery.
Core Traits
RESISTANCES: Silver +1, Mind +1,
Reputation +2
REFRESH: Someone feels deeply moved when they witness your art.
SKILLS: Deceive, Compel
DOMAINS: High Society, Occult
BONDS
• You have a street-level bond to your
adoring fans. Name three of them, and
what the group is most excited to see next.
- Ponges Kelork
- Moy Frowler
- Jul Gil

- I promised my next performance to be a mix of The Comedy of Melfor Desteria (A Opera performed for the house of Destera 200 years ago. It was the last performance staged before the rise of the High elves.) and The Comedy of Howl-Of-Wind-Before-Battle (The first High elf Opera after the fall.). The point is a tribute to the Drow of old (A hidden tribute) and a critical look at the High elf counsel (Though hidden).
• You have a bond with another PC who
you know has feelings for you, even if they
wouldn’t admit it. Describe the moment
when you knew for definite.
(Ed- Scolexis)
EQUIPMENT
• Several sets of flattering clothing
• Tools to create or perform your chosen art
• Small gifts and trinkets from your fans
• A knife (D3, Concealable)

Glagius spent her Durance as an information broker. The more she learned, the more she saw how information was used by her master, the more her hate grew. She was determined to be a beacon of hope for her people. But to do so, she would need to blend in with high society. Using some information gathered during her Durance(Zilvice helped) she managed to perform for high society and quickly grew a following. She would often incorporate subtle anti Aelfir propaganda. The Ministry of Our Hidden Mistress caught on and has asked Glagius to help in a more hands-on way. Her first task, to meet with two other initiates in the Red Row district. A place she has only seen momentarily as a child and has it's horrors etched in her mind.
